PageTitle: set service-mode forwarding-mode (Virtual access AP-ID view)
FuncDef:
The set service-mode forwarding-mode command allows you to set the forwarding mode of a device.
By default, the forwarding mode of a device is redundant.

ParaDef.Info:
redundant.non-redundant.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The device supports two forwarding modes: redundant and non-redundant.
Redundant mode: The interface board has one backup. If the master interface board is faulty or you change the forwarding mode manually, the slave interface board automatically switches to the master state. In this way, the traffic can be forwarded continuously.Non-redundant mode: Two interface boards forward traffic simultaneously. In this way, the forwarding capability of the system is twice stronger than that in the redundant mode.
By default, the device runs in redundant mode. Forwarding mode switching is under license control. Purchase the license in advance. After the license is activated, run the mode switch command. The new forwarding mode takes effect after you restart the device.

Precautions
The new forwarding mode takes effect only when you restart the device. Ensure that you have saved the important data before restart.
